entry.et: Middle English, from Anglo-French supposer, from Medieval Latin supponere (perfect indicative supposui), from Latin, to put under, substitute, from sub- + ponere to put position

def.dt: :to lay down tentatively as a hypothesis, assumption, or proposal suppose a fire broke out suppose you bring the salad
:to hold as an opinion :believe they supposed they were early
:to think probable or in keeping with the facts seems reasonable to suppose that he would profit
